metadata.title: CVE-2018-20783 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
In PHP before 5.6.39, 7.x before 7.0.33, 7.1.x before 7.1.25, and 7.2.xbefore 7.2.13, a buffer over-read in PHAR reading functions may allow anattacker to read allocated or unallocated memory past the actual data whentrying to parse a .phar file. This is related to phar_parse_pharfile inext/phar/phar.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-20783` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php7.2 - 7.2.15-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libphp7.2-embed - 7.2.15-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
php7.2 - 7.2.15-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
php7.2-bcmath - 7.2.15-0ubuntu0.18.04.1

criterions.comment: php7.2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.2.15-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
